issue.title: Query: Injecting into group by projection should check for distinct

milestone.title: MQ
milestone.description: This is a "milestone for quality", which means improving things like test coverage, internal code quality, build systems, etc.

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/pull/27931 Added processing for lifting complex aggregate term to original group by query. See EnclosingTermFindingVisitor

Adding it should be safe in presence of GroupBy since that element could be key or aggregate only (else LINQ wouldn't compile)
But in front of Distinct it may not work. Though there is also another thing that if user doesn't condense grouping element then Distinct should/could fail. We just need to verify the scenario to make sure we are not adding terms into distinct projection.

Similar to #28039

issue.title: Query: Don't add grouping key to projection when Distinct is applied

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

body:
Thanks for the quick resolution.

Will this be part of 6.0.6?
Note from triage: we will prepare a 6.0 patch for this.

issue.title: [release/6.0] Query: Don't add grouping key to projection when Distinct is applied

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Resolves #28039

**Description**

If we need to push current query into a subquery when query has group by operation, we add grouping key to projection so we can refer to them outside but that is incorrect if distinct is applied on the projection since it would change meaning of distinct.

**Customer impact**

Customers running query which are affected by scenario will get incorrect results.

**How found**

Customer reported on 6.0.5

**Regression**

Yes as reported by customer, it worked on 5.0.13

**Testing**

Added tests for affected scenario.

**Risk**

Low. Also added quirk to revert back to older behavior.
